channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: At least 122 children killed in government’s drug war — report
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: In a report released ahead of the three-week session of the UN Human Rights Council, World Organisation Against Torture (OMCT) and the Philippine-based Children’s Legal Rights and Development Center documented 122 killings of children—aged one to 17 years old—between July 2016 and December 2019.

item.title: Comelec extends suspension of voter registration until August 31
item.description: Our field personnel continue to outfit their existing offices and procurer supplies in order to be COVID-19 ready. We are continuously refining our guidelines and health safety protocols so that we do not contribute to the further spread of the virus,” Comelec spokesperson James Jimenez said.

item.title: Oil price hike today
item.author: Danessa Rivera
item.description: Oil companies are implementing another round of price increases on fuel products today.

item.title: COVID-19 may increase illicit activities via darknet — UN
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: As the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic is prompting drug traffickers to find new routes and methods, illicit shipments by mail and activities via the so-called “darknet” may increase, according to the United Nations’ latest annual World Drug Report.

item.title: CSC sets online government job fair
item.author: Elizabeth Marcelo
item.description: Hundreds of jobs in various government offices are expected to be up for grabs as the Civil Service Commission, in partnership with JobStreet.com, is set to hold a nationwide “2020 Government Online Career Fair” or GOCF from Sept. 14 to 18, amid the coronavirus disease 2019 or COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: No disconnections until August — Meralco
item.author: Danessa Rivera
item.description: Manila Electric Co. gave assurance that there will be no line disconnections until the end of August to give customers more time to appraise their electricity bills.

item.title: Cebu City looms as new COVID epicenter — Año
item.author: Neil Jayson Servallos
item.description: Cebu City is “more likely” to be the new epicenter of coronavirus disease 2019 contagion in the country as COVID-19 infections continue to rise, the Department of the Interior and Local Government said yesterday.

item.title: Good riddance, senators tell departing POGOS
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: Senators welcomed yesterday reports that Philippine offshore gaming operators have started to leave the country.

item.title: Government stops return of stranded individuals in 5 areas
item.author: Michael Punongbayan
item.description: The government has approved a moratorium on sending home of locally stranded individuals or LSIs to five areas because of limited quarantine facilities and existing quarantine restrictions.

item.title: 14 Pinoys missing in Mindoro sea mishap
item.author: Evelyn Macairan
item.description: The Philippine Coast Guard yesterday launched search and rescue operations for 14 Filipino fishermen and individuals whose boat capsized after it collided with a Hong Kong-registered vessel off Occidental Mindoro early Sunday.
